Economic Boost: If all world debt was erased, it would give individuals and countries more money to invest in economic growth, leading to an overall economic boom. This could lead to increased job creation, higher wages, and a better standard of living for people around the world.

Reduced Interest Rates: With no debt to pay off, countries could lower interest rates, making borrowing cheaper and more accessible. This could stimulate economic growth by encouraging businesses and individuals to take out loans to invest in new projects or make large purchases.

Increased Consumer Confidence: Without the burden of debt, people would have more disposable income to spend on goods and services. This could lead to increased consumer confidence, which in turn could lead to increased spending and economic growth.

More Investment in Education: With more money available, individuals and governments could invest more in education, leading to better-educated workforces and more skilled employees. This could lead to increased productivity and economic growth.

Changes in Political Systems: The erasure of debt could lead to changes in political systems, as governments may feel less pressure to maintain high levels of debt in order to fund their operations. This could lead to more transparent and accountable governments, as well as changes in how resources are allocated.
